hazards.name: Hidden PitHazard
hazards.Stealth: DC 18 (or 0 if the trapdoor is disabled or broken)
hazards.Description: A wooden trapdoor covers a pit that’s 10 feet square and 20 feet deep.
hazards.Disable: DC 12 to remove the trapdoor
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: A creature walks onto the trapdoor.
hazards.Effect: The triggering creature falls in and takes falling damage (typically 10 bludgeoning damage). That creature can use the Grab an Edge reaction to avoid falling.
hazards.Reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.

hazards.name: Poisoned LockHazard
hazards.Description: A spring-loaded, poisoned spine is hidden near the keyhole of a lock. Disabling or breaking the trap does not disable or break the lock.
hazards.Disable: DC 17 (trained) on the spring mechanism
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: A creature tries to unlock or Pick the Lock.
hazards.Effect: A spine extends to attack the triggering creature.

hazards.name: Slamming DoorHazard
hazards.Description: Pressure-sensitive panels in the floor connect to a stone slab hidden in a hallway’s ceiling.
hazards.Disable: DC 15 (trained) on the floor panels before the slab falls
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: Pressure is placed on any floor tile.
hazards.Effect: Lifting the fallen slab requires a successful DC 25 Athletics check. Hitting the floor panels triggers the trap. The slab uses the same AC and saves as the trap, but it has Hardness 12, HP 48 (BT 24).

hazards.name: Spear LauncherHazard
hazards.Description: A wall socket loaded with a spear connects to a floor tile in one 5-foot square.
hazards.Disable: DC 18 (trained) on the floor tile or wall socket
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: Pressure is applied to the floor tile.
hazards.Effect: The trap shoots a spear, making an attack against the creature or object on the floor tile.

hazards.name: Web Lurker NooseHazard
hazards.Description: Discreet webbing at throat level snags a creature that walks into it.
hazards.Disable: (expert) DC 18 to rearrange the webbing
hazards.Trigger: A creature steps into the square with the web tripwire.
hazards.Effect: The web lurker noose makes a noose Strike against the triggering creature.
hazards.Damage: 3d6 bludgeoning and the target is grabbed and pulled off the ground (Escape DC 22). The target takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it’s caught in the noose.

hazards.name: Electric Latch RuneHazard
hazards.Description: An invisible rune imprinted on a door latch releases a powerful electric discharge.
hazards.Disable: (2nd level; counteract DC 18) to counteract the rune
hazards.Trigger: A creature grasps the door latch directly or with a tool.
hazards.Effect: The trap deals 3d12 electricity damage to the triggering creature (DC 22 basic Reflex save).

hazards.name: Web Lurker DeadfallHazard
hazards.Description: A web tripwire lets loose a bundle of boulders that fall on all targets within a 10-foot square.
hazards.Disable: (expert) DC 20 to rearrange the webbing
hazards.Trigger: A creature steps into the square with the web tripwire.
hazards.Effect: All creatures in the trap’s 10-foot square take 2d6 bludgeoning damage (DC 20 basic Reflex save).

hazards.name: Scythe BladesHazard
hazards.Description: Two blades, each hidden in a 15-foot-long ceiling groove, are both connected to a trip wire.
hazards.Disable: DC 21 (trained) to disable each blade
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: The trip wire is pulled or severed.
hazards.Effect: Both blades swing down, each one attacking all creatures under the ceiling grooves.

hazards.name: Fireball RuneHazard

hazards.Description: An invisible rune creates an invisible, spherical magical sensor with a 20-foot radius.
hazards.Disable: (3rd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract the rune
hazards.Trigger: A living creature enters the sensor area.
hazards.Effect: The rune detonates a fireball centered on the triggering creature’s square. This is a 3rd-level

hazards.name: Hallucination Powder TrapHazard
hazards.Description: A tube of hallucinogenic powder armed with a miniature explosive is connected to a doorknob or similar latch.
hazards.Disable: DC 26 (expert) to disable the hammer that strikes the percussion cap
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: The latch is opened or the tube is broken.
hazards.Effect: The tube explodes, spraying hallucinogenic powder in a 30-foot cone. Any creature in the cone must succeed at a DC 24 Will save or be confused for 1 round and take a –2 status penalty to Perception checks and saves against mental effects for 1d4 hours. On a critical failure, the penalty is instead –4.

hazards.name: Pharaoh's WardHazard

hazards.Description: A curse is imbued on an entryway’s threshold.
hazards.Disable: (4th level; counteract DC 25) to counteract the rune
hazards.Trigger: The seal on the tomb is broken from the outside.
hazards.Effect: Each living creature within 60 feet must succeed at a DC 23 Will save or be subjected to the pharaoh’s curse. A cursed creature takes a –2 status penalty to Fortitude saves, and any natural or magical healing it receives is halved. The curse remains until removed by
hazards.Reset: The trap resets when the door is shut

hazards.name: Yellow MoldHazard
hazards.Description: Poisonous mold spores assault nearby creatures.
hazards.Disable: DC 26 (expert) to remove the mold without triggering the spores
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: A creature moves into the mold’s space or damages the mold. The mold can’t use this reaction if it’s in direct sunlight or if the damage was fire damage.
hazards.Effect: The triggering creature and all creatures within 10 feet are exposed to yellow mold spores.
hazards.Yellow Mold Spores: (inhaled, poison) Any drained condition from the spores persists after the poison’s duration ends;

The pit contains many handholds, so the falling creature can try to Grab an Edge again every 6 seconds. hazards.Description: An object haunted by the echoes of a vicious mind attempts to kill someone who comes near.

hazards.name: Hammer of ForbiddanceHazard 1
hazards.Description: An enormous hammer at an edifice’s entrance swings down in an attempt to damage a creature entering an area, push it back, and prevent it from going any further.
hazards.Disable: DC 28 (expert) once on the hammer itself and once on its joint to prevent the hammer from swinging
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: A creature attempts to enter through the entrance.

hazards.name: Planar RiftHazard 1
hazards.Description: A rift attempts to draw creatures into another plane (the GM chooses the specific plane).
hazards.Disable: (7th level; counteract DC 31) to counteract the rift
hazards.Trigger: A creature moves within 10 feet of the rift.
hazards.Effect: The triggering creature and all creatures within 30 feet of the rift are drawn into another plane. Each creature can attempt a DC 33 Reflex save to avoid this fate.

hazards.Description: Warding magic attempts to trap intruders or would-be thieves in a disrupted time flow.
hazards.Disable: (9th level; counteract DC 36) to counteract the trap before it triggers or to counteract the effect on one creature after the trap is triggered
hazards.Trigger: A creature touches the warded object or area.
hazards.Effect: The triggering creature and all creatures within 30 feet are trapped in a disrupted time flow (DC 38 Fortitude negates). The creatures’ minds move so quickly that each round seems to last a century, but their bodies and magical energies move so slowly that they can’t use any actions except Recall Knowledge. An affected creature must attempt a DC 36 Will saving throw against a

hazards.name: Vorpal ExecutionerHazard 1
hazards.Description: A wickedly sharp saw blade descends and travels along grooves in a complex path throughout the room, attempting to decapitate everyone within.
hazards.Disable: DC 41 (expert) at four different junctions to jam all the saw blade’s possible paths, preventing it from traveling through the room
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: A creature attempts to exit the room.
hazards.Effect: The saw blade travels along its path, making one Strike against each creature in the room, twisting and varying its height for a maximum chance of beheading its targets.
hazards.Damage: 6d12+25 slashing plus decapitation; no multiple attack penalty
hazards.Decapitation: On a critical hit, a target must succeed at a DC 39 Fortitude save or be decapitated, dying instantly unless it can survive without a head.
hazards.Reset: The trap resets over the course of the round and can be triggered again 1 round later.

hazards.name: Second ChanceHazard 2
hazards.Description: Powerful warding magic tied to an object or location tries to regress the ages of a creature and its allies.
hazards.Disable: DC 46 (legendary) to take apart the spell one tiny piece at a time, with eyes closed, while recalling every vivid life memory in order, starting from the earliest memory
hazards.Trigger: A creature tries to steal the object or intrude upon the location. If someone uses a proxy or dupe for the theft or intrusion, the trap unerringly targets the true perpetrator or perpetrators at any distance—even across planes.
hazards.Effect: The triggering creature and up to five coconspirators instantly revert to infants, losing all memories, class abilities, and other skills acquired during their lives (DC 44 Fortitude negates). Reversing this effect is nearly impossible, requiring powerful magic such as

hazards.Description: A roiling red orb, forged from a drop of the god
hazards.Disable: and use them to drain away the orb’s power over 10 minutes; the character attempting this check takes 5 fire damage each round until the orb is depleted
hazards.Trigger: A special condition set by the trap’s creator occurs; this is typically the event of their death.
hazards.Effect: Fire rains from the sky in a 100-mile radius, dealing 10d6 fire damage to creatures and objects in the area. Each creature or object can attempt a DC 46 basic Reflex save. Any creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies instantly. This is not enough damage to completely burn away a forest or level an entire mountain or city, but it typically kills most creatures in the area.

hazards.name: Summoning RuneHazard
hazards.Description: A cloud of invisible magical sensors in a 10-foot radius surrounds an invisible wall or floor rune the size of the creature to be summoned.
hazards.Disable: (1st level; counteract DC 15) to counteract the rune
hazards.Trigger: A creature enters the cloud of magical sensors.
hazards.Effect: This trap summons a specific level 1 creature, determined when the trap is created. The creature rolls initiative and remains for 2d6 rounds, after which the spell ends and the creature disappears. The creature also disappears if someone disables the trap before the duration expires. The summoned creature can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.
hazards.Reset: The trap resets each day at dawn

hazards.Disable: DC 22 to Force Open the trapdoor
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: A creature walks onto the trapdoor.

hazards.Reset: The trap can be reset if the door is manually reengaged and the water tanks refilled; it can be reset without draining the pit, but doing so renders it less effective.

check to

to either raise itself by one step if it’s submerged to its neck or worse, or to move 5 feet if it’s submerged only up to its waist. On a critical failure, the creature is pulled down one step. A creature that Swims out of the quicksand escapes the hazard and is

hazards.Stealth: +12 (trained) (or –10 and no minimum proficiency if the surface is disturbed)
hazards.Description: A 15-foot-wide patch of water and sand attempts to submerge creatures that step onto it.
hazards.Disable: DC 18 (trained) to disturb the surface
hazards.Trigger: A Huge or smaller creature walks onto the quicksand.
hazards.Effect: The triggering creature sinks into the quicksand up to its waist. The quicksand rolls initiative if it hasn’t already.
hazards.Routine: (1 action) On its initiative, the quicksand pulls down each creature within it. A creature that was submerged up to its waist becomes submerged up to its neck, and a creature that was submerged up to its neck is pulled under and has to hold its breath to avoid

hazards.name: Spinning Blade PillarHazard
hazards.Stealth: +11 (trained) or DC 26 (expert) to notice the control panel
hazards.Description: A metal pole with three razor-sharp spinning blades is hidden in the floor, connected to trigger plates in up to eight floor tiles and a hidden control panel within 30 feet.
hazards.Disable: DC 21 (trained) twice on the pillar, or Thievery DC 19 (expert) once on the control panel deactivates the whole trap. Breaking the control panel prevents anyone from disabling the trap using the control panel and prevents the trap from deactivating automatically (see Reset below).
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: A creature steps on one of the trapped floor tiles.
hazards.Effect: The trap pops up in a grid intersection and makes a spinning blade attack against one adjacent creature (if any), then rolls initiative.
hazards.Routine: (3 actions) The trap uses its first action to make a spinning blade Strike against each adjacent creature, its second action to move straight in a random direction (roll 1d4 to determine the direction), and its third action to make a spinning blade Strike against each adjacent creature. This trap doesn’t take a multiple attack penalty.
hazards.Reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.

hazards.name: Wheel of MiseryHazard
hazards.Stealth: +16 (expert) to detect the magical sensor; noticing the wheel has a DC of 0
hazards.Description: An ornate wheel set into a wall—divided into six segments with colored runes on each—is controlled by a magical sensor that detects any creature within 100 feet in front of it.
hazards.Disable: (4th level; counteract DC 22) to counteract each rune
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: A creature enters the sensor’s detection area.
hazards.Effect: The wheel begins to spin and rolls initiative.
hazards.Routine: (2 actions) On its initiative, the trap uses its first action to spin, then stops. Roll 1d6 to determine which segment is topmost when the wheel stops spinning. The wheel uses its second action to replicate the spell listed for that segment (3rd level, DC 24, spell attack roll +14). This spell’s target is centered on or otherwise includes the nearest creature in the area. This increases the spell’s range to 100 feet if necessary. Any spell cast by this trap is arcane.
hazards.Reset: The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any creature moving within range of its sensor.

hazards.name: Poisoned Dart GalleryHazard

hazards.Description: Countless holes to launch poison darts from line a long hallway with a hidden control panel on the far end.
hazards.Disable: DC 21 (expert) on the control panel deactivates the trap.
hazards.HP: 56 (BT 28) to destroy the control panel and disable the trap;
hazards.Immunities: critical hits, object immunities, precision damage
hazards.Trigger: A creature within the active gallery finishes an action.
hazards.Effect: The trap makes a poisoned dart Strike against the triggering creature.
hazards.Routine: (1 action) The trap launches one dart against every creature in the gallery as 1 action. Because it launches darts continuously, the trap can also use the Continuous Barrage free action (see below) to launch darts at each creature during that creature’s turn.
hazards.Damage: 3d4 piercing plus flesset poison; no multiple attack penalty
hazards.Reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.

hazards.name: Telekinetic Swarm TrapHazard 1
hazards.Description: Three innocuous decorations instilled with telekinetic magic pull objects and pieces of the room itself into spinning clouds of debris that attack all creatures in the room.
hazards.Disable: (6th level; counteract DC 30) to counteract each telekinetic decoration
hazards.Trigger: A creature stays in the room for at least 6 seconds.
hazards.Effect: Each telekinetic decoration constructs a cloud of objects in the room (three clouds total) and the trap rolls initiative. The creatures in the room when the trap is triggered become the trap’s targets, regardless of whether they leave the room or other creatures later enter the room. Each decoration targets a different creature if possible. A target creature that moves at least 1 mile from the trap ceases being a target, at which point the decoration designates a new target.
hazards.Routine: If a decoration’s cloud has been destroyed, the decoration instead spends its first action to create a new cloud of objects inside the room (using the starting damage value) and then its second and third actions to have the cloud move and attack.
hazards.Reset: The trap deactivates and resets 10 minutes after it has no target creatures (because the creatures either moved too far away or died).

hazards.Stealth: +24 (master) to notice it isn’t a regular mirror
hazards.Description: A magic mirror replaces characters with evil mirror duplicates from another dimension.
hazards.Disable: (7th level; counteract DC 32) to counteract the mirror for 1 minute and prevent additional replacements during that time
hazards.HP: 4 (BT 2), the mirror can’t be damaged while any mirror duplicate is alive
hazards.Trigger: A non-evil creature is reflected in the mirror.
hazards.Effect: The mirror absorbs the creature into the mirror, replacing it with an evil mirror duplicate (DC 34 Reflex to avoid being absorbed into the mirror), and rolls initiative.
hazards.Routine: (1 action) The mirror absorbs another reflected creature into the mirror and replaces it with a mirror duplicate. Mirror duplicates attack on their own initiative, using the same statistics as the original creature, but with an evil alignment (changing only abilities that shift with the alignment change). A mirror duplicate can spend 3 actions in contact with the mirror to return to its original dimension and release the creature it duplicated, but most mirror duplicates prefer not to.
hazards.Reset: The mirror is always ready to absorb creatures into the other dimension. Ten minutes after a creature is sucked into the mirror, if an ally doesn’t rescue the creature with Thievery, it reaches the other dimension, where it might be captured or killed. In the mirror dimension, it counts as a mirror duplicate, so the denizens of the other dimension can’t destroy the mirror on their side while the absorbed creature is there.
